p: In the analysis of the chemical composition of Croton blanchetianus Baill., Angélico ( 2011) noted the presence of 15 chemical compounds, with the majoritarian compounds being cedrol (28.4%), eucalyptol (17.4%) and α-pinene (10.5%); thus, their results corroborate with those of this study. Souza et al. ( 2006) analyzed the chemical composition of the fixed oil from the bark of Croton cajucara Benth. from the regional ‘Ver-o-Peso’ market, located in Belém, Pará, and noted the occurrence of alloaromadendrene, linalool and spathulenol in its composition; these compounds were also detected in our study.
